review: Olanzapine (5mg) This drug has caused weight gain for me and constant shaking.  I was happy for a bit then just wanted to die. It does help me sleep but my moods are all over the place. Honestly if you don't have bi polar or schizophrenia try and stay away from it.  I can't go off of it because I need it.

I have tried a litany of prescription sleep medications over the last 20 years.  A month ago, I started on Zyprexa 5mg.  It helped me sleep about 4-5 hours a night without the morning grogginess of Ambien.  I went up to 7.5 mg, and sleep is great.  I tried 10 mg for a week, but the hunger pangs were too much to handle, and my blood sugar was over 300!  On 7.5, my blood sugar is gradually coming down to acceptable levels.  I also have the extra benefit of being able to set aside my busy thoughts and live in the moment.  I'm loving it.  I hope this will not be one of those meds that I need more and more of over time.  Will report back in 6 months!  Meanwhile, Zyprexa is worth a look if other sleep meds haven't worked for you.

My only problem was falling asleep before important days before Olanzapine. The psychiatrist prescribed me 1.25 mg of Olanzapine + SSRI. I realized that my mood was exactly the same and the only difference was Olanzapine was making me sleep so well. The crazy weight gain was unstoppable. Since my doctor did not care about my concerns I stopped abruptly Olanzapine of 1,25mg. It has been 2 years and it caused permanent insomnia. My only problem was falling asleep before this poison and now my problem became maintaining the sleep. I see thousands of people suffer the same. If you are planning to use this for insomnia, just stay away from this poison. I believe psychiatrists are not aware the real risks of this drug and it may cause permanent damage. Just stay away from this thing. I lost my ability of sleep because of this, and eventually it destroyed my life.

I have been on this drug olanzapine for a year now and so far I love it.  I used to hear voices and could hardly sleep at night but this drug olanzapine together with amitriptyline have made my life better. My only issue is the weight gain and I'm afraid of getting diabetes due to prolonged intake of olanzapine. I don't know how to get off this drug (even though it seems to work okay with me)..it somehow causes a little bit of depression even though it's an antidepressant itself. Good luck to everyone reading this
I  had 15mg once, this stuff is useless. I had amnesia and felt weird, cannot recommend this medication for anything.

This drug ruined my life. I took a low dose for mild insomnia and anxiety, and after a while it turned out I can't stop taking it. I have tried tapering very slowly over many months, but it is a nightmare. I am now taking half the original dose, and insomnia and anxiety and heart palpitations and brain fog are through the roof. It's not temporary withdrawal, I've been at this dose for a year now. I'm much much much worse off than before I started taking this stuff. AVOID!

I have been taking olanzapine for 25 years. Dosage was changed many times, from 15  to 20mg. Because of age I have been on 10mg for the last 4years. Every time Dr. tries to increase by even 2.5mg I get severe insomnia. So looks like I'm leaving it at 10. Overall it has been an amazing drug.

I have been taking olanzapine for about 3.5 years now. Some nights I don't take it, other nights 2.5 mg, and other nights 5mg. It helps tremendously with my sleep when I'm intolerant to it. If my tolerance builds up, I might have to "muscle out" a few nights so that it it can then affect me better. These nights of having to go without it can be rough. For me, if not sure that I'll sleep at all, I find that taking olanzapine ends up being the better choice. I think sleep/calmness is healthier than no sleep/panic , even though olanzapine may some potentially unhealthy side effects. Speaking of the side effects, I have noticed it increase my appetite, but I can still control my weight. There is some drowsiness, but I don't mind it because I at least feel well rested. I do want to eventually quit due to long term potential side effects, but it is hard to get off I must say.

Was put on it as an ajunct with effexor,mirtazapine,zopiclone,promethazine,lyrica and epilem.Im bi polar and epileptic.It did nothing except make me fat, blunted my emotions,raised my cholesterol and white bllod cells went haywire.
I took this drug for a year, my doctor, prescribed it to me for sleep, oh my stars, I cannot believe a doctor can be so uneducated and irresponsible to use this as a sleeping pill.

Olanzapine ruined my life. if you don't have bipolar or schizophrenia do NOT take this horrible garbage. Doctors say it isn't addicting or part of the issue so they will never take responsibility of the real permanent damage caused by this horrible drug. If your doctor tries prescribing you this stuff just for insomnia,  run. the doctor does not  care if anything were to happen to you.

I have mild chronic insomnia, about two nights a week I can’t sleep at all. I've tried herbs and drowsy antihistamines but they didn’t work, my doctor suggested trying Olanzapine before trying a benzodiazepine. I was prescribed 5mg, my doctor said try one when I couldn’t sleep. So one night when I was lying in bed from 9pm to 3am and couldn’t fall asleep I tried one Olanzapine, and by 4am I was so tired and fell asleep pretty quickly and slept 10 hours. If I hadn’t of taken Olanzapine I would of been up for the remainder of the night and all day. I didn’t experience any side effects, I highly recommend it as a sleep aid if you only use it every now and then.

I was put on this in conjunction with Prozac and Ativan. I took this drug for a month and all it did was increase my appetite. I started out at 5mg then increased to 10 and I felt drugged. My depression worsened and I started having anxiety and panic attacks. I’m now at 2.5 mg. My doctor used this as a sleeping pill which only worked moderately. Use this pill with caution. If you aren’t bipolar or have a severe mental illness then stay away from this drug.
I was given 10mg of Olanzapine for 'SLEEP' ... now when I try to sleep without it I JUST CAN'T!!!Stay away from this drug, I wish I researched before taking it.

I was given 2.5mg of generic Zyprexa for insomnia and anxiety. After the first night I noticed quickly that I only needed half a pill 1.75mg. 2.5mg knocked me out cold and I had a hard time getting up to pee midway through the night. Next day was sleepiness and fatigue that is only comparable too high doses of Lunesta or Ambien. I also had a hard time with thoughts and speech. When I tried half a pill the next day was much more tolerable. Good luck with this med if you are given it.

DO NOT TAKE THIS MED FOR SLEEP! It will help you sleep for a little while, then your sleep will get worse with time, then you will not be able to sleep without it once you try getting off. I'm going on 3 and 1/2 weeks off it after a slow taper and it has destroyed my sleep cycle. It's also left me with worse depression, anxiety, and exhaustion (all things that were starting to worsen after a few months on this med). Trust me, if you're not bi-polar or schizophrenic, do not take this medication, especially if you're just using it for sleep. You will regret it.

I love Zyprexa! Been on it four years. Before I couldn't sleep or eat! I will say I have put on weight and I would suggest eating every four to five hours because the hunger can be overwhelming sometimes. But I have slept so much better and oddly enough,  I feel happier!

This medication is an absolute life saver. I was so scared to try it and I’ve been on a laundry list of other meds for insomnia and nothing worked. I went from having disrupted shallow sleep for a couple hours every night to sleeping through the entire evening, waking up after 8-9 hours feeling rested without any side effects aside from some very mild daytime sleepiness which is a trade off I'm more than willing to accept right now. Give this a try if you’re on the fence about it. I’m taking 5mg at night and that dose works like a charm for me.

I was on olanzapine for three years. It worked well for me. However, the weight gain was terrible. I'm a healthy eater but gained 40 lbs. I have cerebral palsy and walk with a cane. It got to the point where I put on so much weight when I would fall I couldn't get back up. However,  it is fantastic for sleep.

Prescribed olanzapine 5mg tablets in order to withdraw from zopiclone following severe anxiety and insomnia. I have nothing but praise for olanzapine -it gives you a peaceful calm feeling allowing you to get natural sleep. No after effects at lower dosage. 5mg is enough for a 13 stone man in my case. I only got this prescribed by my primary mental health team as doctors seemed happy to prescribe Z drugs which left me dependent on them to sleep.

Did you notice, no matter how mg of Olanzapine you take in the day time you wouldn't just sleep. I'm taking 20mg over 24 hours. 10mg in the night and 10mg in the afternoon but all I notice is that I don't sleep in the afternoon.
I took one 10mg olanzapine as prescribed and it literally knocked me down for a full 24 hours.

I had a misdiagnosis of bipolar and I'm sure the insomnia started around the time I tapered off it. I was on it for over a year and the insomnia has lasted for 2 years. I'm frustrated that I see other people here have had bad experiences and the side effects are similar and had bad withdrawals but the Doctors never validate me when I ask if Olanzipine was the reason for this chronic insomnia or take responsibility that the reason you are still sick could be the drugs they prescribed and not down to poor sleep hygiene. I've now gone private but I doubt anyone will ever tell me the truth and more drugs will be prescribed to combat the problems they were the cause of in the first place. All I needed was therapy which I got eventually on the NHS but the legacy of the misdiagnosis and all the powerful drugs has ruined my life and I can't even work. I don't even have a mental health diagnosis anymore apart from insomnia.

My best friend was on 10 mg of Olanzapine for 25 years.  He made the decision to get off of it with the Doctors's guidance because it caused his diabetes and was making his diabetes worse. I am also on olanzapine and my friend told me he will be the guinea pig and get off of it first and if he is ok then I will know to get off of it. He got off of it 4 months ago and his insomnia was so bad that he went 4 months with hardly any sleep at all.  Doctor prescribed hydroxyzine for his insomnia but it didn't work.   My friend could NOT sleep and got very very sick from not sleeping and was so confused.  He took his life and died August 8, 2020 as a result.  I lost my best friend due to olanzapine.

Before I started taking Olanzapine I could not sleep properly losing a lot of sleep. In fact I would go 72 hours without a wink of sleep.  Now I get a full 9 hours sleep throughout the night.  It is a miracle drug.  If you cannot sleep properly I highly recommend taking Olanzapine.
was on olanzapine for 6 months it caused permanent brain damage and now  I can't sleep at night DO NOT TAKE THIS!!! This is the most addicting drug in the world!!! Trash psychiatrist

Took this medication olanzapine for about 2 and 1/2 months. I was suicidally anxious when my psychiatrist decided to give this a try. Made me very tired for the first few days but it nearly eliminated my anxiety and it helped me sleep better. Over time, though, I started having diminishing returns at even 10mg, along with feeling like I was becoming dumber (having trouble focusing, trying to remember certain words)... It just made me more foggy and depressed. Decided to get off it and didn't realize til a few days after that I was having bad withdrawals (nausea, anxiety, worse sleep). I would not recommend this med. I'm trying to conquer my severe depression and poor sleep and this is making everything way worse. Even cutting to small pieces to taper is hardly helping. Wish I never started it.

Horrendous withdrawal symptoms. I was on olanzapine for insomnia for only 12 days. After stopping it I had 2 weeks of withdrawals symptoms nausea, fatigue, flu like symptoms, brain fog and more than a week of insomnia. My brain doesn’t know how to sleep without this drug and works really hard to regain the ability to sleep on its own. Even on it I didn’t have good sleep, went to bed at 11 up until 2am then slept until 11 am. It made me a zombie while on it. Stay away from this awful drug !!!!!!

Im back to leave another review after being on olanzapine for a couple of months. I started taking 10mg now I take 15mg. So the issue I was so scared of was weight gain. When I started taking it I was 80 pounds, very sick and unhealthy. It helped me gain back my normal weight, back to 100-105lbs. Other than when I first started taking it, it hasn't had an effect on my hunger or weight anymore. I think it can cause weight gain if you allow it too. If you exercise, and eat normal weight gain shouldn't be an issue for you.  The reason I rate this a 9 is because it does make it hard for me to get up and going like I used to prior to taking this drug, but I'd pick that over a sleepless night any day.

Chronic insomnia my whole life with 2 short breaks - when I left the unstable home where I lived as a child. Then once my 2 daughters recovered from gastric reflux and finally developed a sleep pattern by age 10. I was good then till hysterectomy /menopause  2008. So this about has been ongoing for 12 years

Zyprexa gives me the best sleep ever, but I'm tired constantly and it makes me so uncontrollably hungry. Just need to be careful about what you eat. It helps my mood too as I also have bipolar disorder. I'd recommend it if you truly can't sleep and have bipolar disorder and/or ocd.

I have experienced significant cognitive problems as a side effect of olanzapine. The forgetfulness is pretty bad, and can be alarming at times. When the dosage was decreased, I saw improvement, especially in my short-term memory. It is significant and noticeable. I’m coming off the medication solely to address the memory problem, otherwise, I would still take it for insomnia. Losing so much working memory makes it very hard to read much, etc.

On 5mg Helps me sleep 8 hours the only downside is it increases your Cholesterol and Excessive eating.I take 20 mgs of Crestor to hep control the  cholesterol or it will be off the charts, I take Gabapentin with it before bed but when I wake up I’m an eating machine went from 110 pounds to 125 pounds in a month.
olanzapine gave me the best sleep I have had in years,  I sleep 10 hours or more,  a deep sleep.....

This medication Olanazapine is great for sleep and OCD (Obsessive Thoughts) I take 10mg at night and sleep all night long. I didn't rate this a 10 because is does 100% have a side effect that is hard for me to become comfortable with, which is the increase in hunger. When I started taking this drug I was under weight. Now I am back to my normal weight. It just increases your hunger for sure. So if you struggle with weight issues I would look into something else before this drug, but as far as sleep goes, it is perfect. I just am going to have to get used to the increase hunger and how to control it.

I have been diagnosed with a mood disorder and possible bipolar. I was recently put on zyprexa 10 mg 1×daily. Is this medicine addicting? Also I experience severe anxiety and paranoia.What would you say is my problem? I need help!!

For side effects how about dreaming? Now I have long dreams, funny part of this drug. However I wish I had another way to get sleep because the other side effect of olanzapine is getting fat  which is horrible.

there have to be another way to get in sleep mode, meditation and a nice routine of exercise and diet, however when I took this drug I sleep, I really don't want it but is the only salvation, now I'm fat and just a month has passed. But I sleep!

I suffered SEVERE insomnia from early childhood. Not until completely psychotic did any drug work. I don't think I slept at all for 5 days at 18 years old. Then I was given zyprexa 5mg. I slept. Unfortunately a few days later I once again didn't sleep for 3 days. Now given 10mg zyprexa. I slept. This cycle continued to 20mg. From that time 17 years ago I have weaned to 7.5mg. An awakening has occurred at the 7.5mg mark. This is the most stable I have ever been. Through diet, exercise and lifestyle choices. If you are advised to take olanzapine be sure your psychiatrist knows everything about your health. Sleep, diet, drug abuse, any recent trigger events etc. it's a tough tough road

For years I suffered from insomnia. My doctors tried ambien benzos antidepressants seroquel and antihistamine and nothing worked for me. I saw a new doctor who put me on ten milligrams of Olanzapine and it was a success. I am now currently on 20mgs at night. It puts me to sleep but the hunger and weight gain is severe.

If you want want to have zero quality of life I urge you to take olanzapine. I was prescribed this horrific drug just for insomnia. For the first 6 months it sedated me, then I started developing horrific side effects (inability to swallow, restlessness, anxiety, being in a zombielike state, etc). Eventually I developed a tolerance so it no longer helped me sleep either. Sadly, I know others who have taken this drug who have developed permanent movement disorders and brain damage. It effect heaps neurotransmitters in your brain. After stopping this drug cold turkey because I couldn’t swallow anything, I have been left with 9 months of 0-2 hours of sleep. This drug will ruin your life. Check out all the lawsuits against Eli Lilly. You’ve been warned. I wish I had been!

Great for sleep! Olanzapine is a great sleep aid alternative to addictive sleep medication. I take 5mg at night and I sleep 8 - 10 hours without waking up throughout the night (I used to sleep 5 - 6 hours and waking up several times). For the first couple of weeks you’ll feel groggy and be hungry but these side effects will go away. I’ve been on Olanzapine for 3 months and it’s still working great for sleep.

Male, 10 mg of this with 10 mg of ambien made me sleep like a baby 8+ hours. It was very hard to get out of bed. If I drank a six pack of beer on this I could not drive properly in the morning for 4+ hours.  Ambien by itself gives me 5-6 hours of sleep. And I can drive just fine in the morning if I drink a 6 pack the night before. This drug made me feel kinda like a zombie and I gained weight. It was given to me for anxiety of which it did not help. Though I would not mind trying it again at a lower dose combined with ambien to help me sleep 8 hours.I've got a few old pills and ran out of Ambien so will see what 10 mg does by itself.

Prescribed 2.5mg for anxiety and insomnia. Helped a lot at first, then after several months sleep problems returned. Anxiety started getting worse. I tried to slowly lower my dosage and anxiety and insomnia got worse than ever. After 2 years I started having tardive dyskinesia symptoms and trembling. And never feel rested. My sleep was very light, not deep. Again tried to reduce dosage but couldn't sleep at all and had unbearably intense anxiety. 4 years later I'm stuck on this awful medication, hardly sleeping at all, high anxiety, foggy slow brain, with tardive dyskinesia. Before I took olanzapine my only problem was mild anxiety and insomnia. This drug causes permanent damage. This drug ruined my life.

I’ve used Olazapine 2.5 mg (dosage one)  for years. It works great for me, it gives me a good 8 - 10 hours sleep a night without waking up throughout the night and I always wake up feeling like I’ve had a great nights sleep. Don’t be put off by the scare tactics of other reviewers  2.5mg or 5mg dosages do affect the same neurotransmitters but only mildly. You’re not going to develop psychosis when you start taking this medication or when you stop taking it. I’ve stopped and started Olanzapine many times and I’ve no issues whatsoever, no mood changes (it actually helped improve some anxiety issues) .Just be cautious of weight gain but at a low dose you’ll barely gain any weight, and if you eat healthy and workout you’ll be more than fine.

Zyprexa is not a sleep medication and should not be prescribed for sleep issues. It is a powerful anti-psychotic approved and used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.  It is one of the most potent, if not the most potent anti-psychotic.  Once on it, in most cases, it is virtually impossible to get off it.  Psychiatrists and other doctors are told that it does not have addictive or withdrawal effects.  Once on Zyprexa, most people cannot get off it without major side effects. Psychiatrists call this discontinuation syndrome, but for lay people, it is no different than withdrawal.  At first, it will help your sleep and, over time, it will loose its potency, requiring ever higher and more dangerous amounts of a drug that affects myriad chemicals in the brain and has been shown to shrink brain tissue.  Do your research.  Be very careful.

I started zyprexa about 5 years ago. The first time I took it, it definitely helped with sleep but I was very groggy in the morning and had a hard time doing my chores and daily things. I took it for a while longer and learned you have to take it very early in the evening so your not so groggy in the morning. It helped calm my mind and anxiety. I started gaining weight so I went on a diet and exercise regime. It helped but I still wasn't happy with my amount of weight loss. So I had my Dr put me on something else. I've been miserable for 5 years with anxiety which I take a benzo for and I had the racing thoughts and depression. I tried all sorts of drugs for my insomnia, doxepin, mirtazapine and  seroquel. They all had horrible side effects. I felt like I was in outer space. So today after a lengthy time of stress and no sleep asked my new dr if I could go back on zyprexa so tonight I'm taking 20mg of zyprexa and 200mg of trazodone. I'm a little nervous so we will see what happens. Wish me luck!

I take 10mg late evenings alongside my anti depressant called Depokote...Makes me tired and quickly settles me down 1hr then quality sleep normally. Have weird dreams and lots of dreaming seemingly. Appetite wise I'm seemingly feeling constantly hungry and therefore doubling my usual daily ifood intake so weight gained real quick... How can I lose it again whilst on olanzipine ?
Works greatly

The relatively low dose on Zyprexa and eventually the generic - I prefer the generic tablet that it may be broken in half in many dosages - helped to taper off the Seroquel nightmare. I still take a low dose every so often to get to sleep and wow how powerful these meds are. I am hopeful to find a strain of marijuana that will eventually  take care of my sleep probs even though it was the drug that messed up my sleep from the beginning.
This is the worst drug for anything made me paranoid and couldn't do anything. I talk to a psychiatrist on the 29th hopefully I can convince her to take me off, she isn't the one that put me on it.

I take two 50mg tablets of trazadone plus 1 2.5mg tablet of olanzapine about half hour before I'm ready to "hit the hay" on an EMPTY stomach in which I within 10-15mins eat a light snack not too hard to digest and sounds like a lie but it's not within 8 minutes I'm out like a light...worth asking about , right?
Causes brain shrinkage in studies.Made me lose motivation.Made me fat.Blurs vision.uncoordinated and your hands shake.lose memory, and cannot talk properly.

Started Zyprexa 3 weeks ago - my primary side effect is insomnia - I go to sleep but awaken through the night and then early morning awakening.  My sleep has been reduced to 5-6 hours a night - I have MS and my sleep is vital to control that, so hopefully my Dr can help with the lack of sleep issue.

I have suffered from terrible insomnia for quite some time. Every time I get better, then my body becomes used to it.  Currently I take 5mg with 50mg Serequel and 15mg Midozalm. This is a lot of medication and keep in constant contact with my Docters.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I developed an illness that evolved in stages.  A few stages in I lost the ability to sleep naturally.  This was about eleven years ago.   A few years went by trying every sleep med with utter failure.  Ambien, Lunesta, benzodiazepines, trazadone, most atypical antipsychotics.  Eventually a new lifestyle evolved where I would be up for near three days straight then sleep for a full day, repeat.  What finally put me to sleep was a little risperidone and a megadose of seroquel.  Risperdal "allowed" me to fall asleep, while max dose of seroquel "KEPT ME in sleeping state "long enough" and "deep enough."  3am now, tried 10mg of zyprexa an hour ago alone, its barely affecting me. Remeron with halved seroquel/risperdal, put me down great.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):This medicine has made me gain a lot of weight due to the fact I get hungry about 2 hours after taking it. After eating I always pass out and sleep through the night till I have to wake up for my job at 7 a.m. I have been taking this medication for two years now so I do not wake up groggy and foggy. This medication to me is a life saver for putting me to sleep and keeping me asleep. Just be careful with the night hungers! Other then that would totally recommend the medication if you can't sleep at night.
I can only think you are all in the U.S. In the U.K this drug is given to treat schizophrenia, severe schizophrenia. Good luck to you all

Olanzapine puts me to a restful sleep. Works better than OTC sleeping  drugs, hands down. Many prescription sleeping pills I had a bad reaction to, like being groggy in the morning having restless leg, very  nervous. it slows my thought process down for a great restfull sleep.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):After having tried just about every medication. Zyprexa is the one that kept me asleep. Of course there are some mornings I wake up early. Like about 4-5 in the morning. Those nights are rare. As far as weight gain? It hasn't been an issue. And I wish everybody the best of luck while taking these medications. Because finding the right fit takes lots of patience:)

Zyprexa (olanzapine):Started Zyprexa 5mg for a week, bumped up to 10mg...This medication works well for me. Im able to control my depression & irritability better. Weight gain is fine for me as I only weiged 98 pounds when I started the medication, I am now 108 after two weeks & I am not complaining. I've been getting insomnia since starting the 10mg. I wake up around 12,1 or 2 in the am and cant go back to sleep. Will definitely talk to Psych about this problem

Was born with insomnia.Now 57 years and had ZERO SLEEP since the beginning of October 2016, with severe bouts of insomnia since December last year.I'm having this surreal feelings from total lack of sleep.It is now 2:45am.Normally I just lie awake in bed until the birds start to sing.Had been on all available sleeping tablets and now have built up a resistance/tolerance to it, thus the zero sleep.Cannot go to work because of it.I've stumbled upon an olanzapine packet which apparantly was given to me in hospital after I fell 2 storeys high and broke my pelvis in 2 places, broke also my hip, sitting bone and squashed 2 vertebrae.They gave me Olanzapine in hospital to help me lie still flat on my back.I just took 5mg hope for the best please:)

I am Taking 20mg of Zeprexa & 15mg of Tamazapam. I'm 43 yrs old. Im lucky if I get 1 to 2 hours of a sleep.I just started taking Zeprexa a week ago? Do I have to wait until several weeks for Zeprexa to take effect or Should I try another medication?
great medicine for strange thinking or ocd. gained over 70lbs though

Success, success, success! Review Part 2. I now take Xyprexa every day. I take it early so I don't get a hang over effect the next day. Before, I got away with taking it every other day but that doesn't work anymore. with 8 hours sleep an night I am thankful. I don't feel like a zombie. I am taking a higher dose for awhile as to better the longer term effect.
This is the only medicine I have taken for insomnia that helps me sleep. at least seven hours. Only drawback is if I take too late at nite I am drowsy for few hours when I wake up.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):It's Definetely was a love/hate relationship with Zyprexa. I have tried virtually every sleep drug available, and it was one of the best because it not only put me to sleep, but it also KEPT me asleep for 8 hours. Started at 2.5mg, then 5mg, & eventually 7.5. It did take a long time to kick in though, so I had to take it 2 hours before bedtime. But like everybody who takes this, I gained weight. But I found the 1 way you can actually lose weight on this drug, which is to combine exercise with Atkins diet (low carb). Zyprexa gives you metabolic syndrome. You no longer burn carbs, which means all carbs you eat becomes body fat, which is why you become fat on this stuff (so you have to stop eating carbs). I got off this drug after 1 year.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I have been prescribed Zyprexa 10mg just two days ago. It was prescribed for insomnia and an extra medication for my depression. I have not slept as well as I was told I would. I have had major restlessness in my legs and arms to where I haven't slept well at all. I have felt very drowsy during the day. I have also tried Ambein which also gave me restlessness in my legs. Not sure if this is right one for me either. Maybe I just need more time? I have noticed I am eating more throughout the day. Not worried about that so much since I need to put on some weight.

Success, success, success! I have been on and off olanzapine since I was 18 years old, more off like 99% off and I can say my sleep has been horrible but now I take olanzapine every second night, 10MG and I sleep approximately 8 hours a night. No hangover effects like taking 10MG a night. Shit, doctors say to take 10MG a night are they crazy? why don't they try and take olanzapine before they dose up and ruin lifes.I have taken 10MG a night in the past nightly and it's virtually impossible to get out of bed and during the day you can't think or talk like a human being, I become a social introvert. Doctors want to take this?Only side effect I can say with olanzapine is appetite up/weight gain carbs so watch diet *paleo* carbs kill/weight
I can finally sleep at night again

Zyprexa (olanzapine):If you take this medicine, don't expect to be able to stay awake during the day for a while. It takes time to get used to. As far as how good it is at helping you get to sleep? 10/10, I can't imagine propofol would be more effective.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):Ok, so while I have only begun this last night.. I can say I did fall asleep, which doesn't happen until after midnight, and I only woke up once to pee. I slept for almost 10 hours compared to my restless 4 if that. My only complaint so far is this entire day I have wanted to do NOTHING. I am so tired, I don't want to do anything besides sleep and I don't like this feeling. And I can say I've been hungier today than usual, so I'm paying attention to what I'm eating so I don't overeat.. After a while I'll update my review.

I was prescribed Olanzpine for insomnia and it worked like a charm, was on 2.5 mg sometimes 5mg and would always get 8 - 10 hour sleep without waking, also no severe hangover effect the following morning. Downside is it significantly increases your appetite so you need to be cautious of subsequent weight gain thus I would only recommend olanzapine if you're suffering from a severe bout of insomnia.
I take 5 mg of olanzapine and this medicine does help me sleep well at night.I think it's a good medicine.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):This medicine is a God send. I've tried every sleeping pill in the book (Ambien, Trazodone, Seroquel, Elavil, ETC.) None of them would keep me asleep the whole night. 10mg of this and I sleep like a baby and don't have the racing thoughts. Only problem is it's real hard to get out of bed and get moving.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I went to a psychiatrist for sleep meds and was prescribed 5 mg. Zyprexa. It helped me sleep but as soon as I stopped taking the medicine after two weeks, I experienced severe insomnia, sweating, palpitation, agitation depression and agitation. I had to be put back on it to to stabilize. I am now taking 7.5 mg. I don't like the effect on me and I will try to taper off of this medicine. I wish I had known about the side effects and widthrawal symptoms of this medicine.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):This medicine is the best sleep aid I have found. I tried Ambien and it made me crazy. I can sleep with Zyprexa and wake up the next morning with no side effects. I just have to make sure I take it early in the evening. If I take it too late, it will make me groggy in the morning. Unlike some of the reports I have heard, it doesn't effect my weight at all.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I used Zyprexa (2.5mg) at night for insomnia caused by anxiety and obsessive thoughts. It is the only thing that helped me sleep that is not addictive and actually worked. It also helped my appetite because when I don't sleep well I don't feel like eating much either. This medication helped with that also. Unfortunately I cannot use it often because it causes my blood sugar to shoot up sky high and I don't like the risk of tardive dyskinesia. I only take a very small dose when I haven't slept in awhile.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I tried this after Risperidone (which gave me dyskensia) and Seroquel. It works and makes me tired (when I was a teenager I used it as a sleeping pill). Lots of weight gain though.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):I do have really bad insomnia (for the past 6 years) but this was prescribed to me for daytime use to help keep me calm. It in no way makes me sleepy but works great for my ADHD. I have also gained nearly 10 pounds in only 2 weeks. I'm not a normal eater, usually I only eat dinner, but on this medicine I seem to have doubled what I would normally eat. I'm addressing that issue now. Good calming down medicine I must say.
Zyprexa (olanzapine):I gained 10 pounds in 7 days on this.

Zyprexa (olanzapine):This medication was prescribed to help with my insomnia. It was in combination with my antidepressant medication. It did help me sleep, but it was difficult for me to wake up and function normally the next day.
